cab.content: CONFIDENTIAL LIBRARY.140DXTOiENT IS THE PROPERTY Off HIS BRITA^LIC MAJESTY1 B GOVERNMENT.)THE UNELVPL ORIENT INSURANCE BILL. Note by the Secretary.During the Cabinet discussion on the Unemployment Insurance Bill on June 26th (Cabinet 31 (25), Conclusion 4), the Chancellor of the Exchequer stipulated that no increased charge should fall on the Exohequer during the current financial yearly reason of the increased State contribution. In the draft Bill which was before the Cabinet it is provided that this increase should take effect from 4th January next and as a consequence a supplementary Vote of about ^00,000 would have been required for 1925/26. The Chancellor of the Exchequer proposed therefore that the date in the Bill should be altered to some date on or after the 1st April, 1926, but the Minister of labour did not regard this suggestion as being covered by the decision of the Cabinet, The matter y/as thereupon referred to the Prime Minister who decided that the Chancellor's proposal should be adopted and the Bill now before the House of Commons accordingly provides that the increased State contribution shall date from the 5th April next.complete the Cabinet1 s records on the subject, this decision should be ta&en note of at an early meeting.S C R BT.CABINET.P. 323 .(2,5.1.The Prime Minister suggested that, in order to(Signed) M. P. A. HANKEY.Secretary to the Cabinet.2 Whitehall Gardens, S,f,I, 3rd July, 1925,
